Issues.Title: Textbox right click menu incorrect after mouse move.
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET SDK (reflecting any global.json):
 Version:   6.0.300
 Commit:    8473146e7d

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.22000
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win10-x64
 Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\6.0.300\

Host (useful for support):
  Version: 6.0.5
  Commit:  70ae3df4a6

.NET SDKs installed:
  3.1.419 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  5.0.408 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  6.0.101 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  6.0.105 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  6.0.202 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  6.0.203 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  6.0.300 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]

.NET runtimes installed:
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.All 2.1.30 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.All]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 2.1.30 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 3.1.25 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 5.0.17 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 6.0.1 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 6.0.5 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 2.1.30 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 3.1.25 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 5.0.17 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 6.0.4 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 6.0.5 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 3.1.25 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]
  Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 5.0.17 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]
  Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 6.0.1 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]
  Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 6.0.4 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]
  Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 6.0.5 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]

To install additional .NET runtimes or SDKs:
  https://aka.ms/dotnet-download


### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

I don't think it's ever worked. I raised a [question on Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/13162460/how-do-you-stop-a-textbox-showing-the-default-context-menu/72416369#72416369) nine years ago when I was using Windows XP Pro SP3 & .Net 3.5 and never got a good answer. It didn't work with the old ContextMenu and it still doesn't work with the new ContextMenuStrip.

### Issue description

If you move the mouse off of a text box between right clicking it and releasing the right mouse button the wrong context menu shows.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a new WinForms app in Visual Studio.
2. Place a text box on the form called textBox1.
3. Make the code behind look like this:

```
namespace WinFormsApp1;

public partial class Form1 : Form
{
    public Form1()
    {
        this.InitializeComponent();
        ContextMenuStrip menu = new ContextMenuStrip();
        menu.Items.Add("Hello World", null, HelloWorld_Clicked);
        textBox1.ContextMenuStrip = menu;
    }

    private void HelloWorld_Clicked(object? sender, EventArgs e)
    {
        MessageBox.Show("Hello World!");
    }
}

```
4. Run the application.
5. Right click on the textbox with the mouse and hold the button down.
6. Move the mouse off the text box (note this is important if the mouse is still on the text box it works).
7. Release the right mouse button.

I would expect to see a context menu appear that looks like this, with only a Hello World option:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5264795/170890048-8121e770-e569-4775-828d-92557b6da12b.png)

What I actually get is the default text box context menu, that looks like this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5264795/170890073-5a8afa23-0f0f-495a-b028-90d246ed90fa.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Textbox right click menu incorrect after mouse move." (#7236)

Issues.Title: Reading application settings in NET WinForms OOP designer fails with exception 'Invalid URI: The hostname could not be parsed"
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Version 17.2.2

### .NET version

net6.0-windows

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

No, this is new in VS2022 and the NET WinForms OOP designer.

### Issue description

This is an issue in the new NET WinForms designer when using the microsoft.winforms.designer.sdk to add design-time support to a custom NET6 WinForms control. Reading application settings at design-time fails with exception ‚ÄúInvalid URI: this hostname could not be parsed‚Äù.

I also reported this as feedback from VS2022:
https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/Reading-application-settings-fails-in-th/10055004





### Steps to reproduce

My github sample to reproduce:
https://github.com/tracktownsoftware/MicrosoftWinFormsDesignerSDK_AppSettingsBug

The above repository includes a Nuget package you can use to test and reproduce. The nuget package contains a custom NET6 WinForms "MyButton" control with WinForms Designer Extensibility SDK design-time support.

### Diagnostics

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Reading application settings in NET WinForms OOP designer fails with exception 'Invalid URI: The hostname could not be parsed"" (#7233)

Issues.Title: SaveFileDialog gives irritating error message when using ransomware protection in Windows 10 or 11
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 6.0.5 on latest Windows 11 (21H2 / 22000.675)

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

I don't know üôÅ But I don't think so.

### Issue description

When I use a `SaveFileDialog` to create a none-existing file on a modern Windows system with activated ransomware protection, I get the error message: "File not found." üôÑ It would be better, though, to raise a message like e.g. "Cannot write to this directory".

### Steps to reproduce

- Activate the ransomware protection in Windows 10 or 11
- Use my .NET 6 MWE project located here: https://devops.tsommer.org/mwe/issues/BugWinFormsSaveFileDialog
- Run the program
- Click the button
- Navigate into any protected folder
- Try to create a new file
- Getting the error message "File not found." üôÑ
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "SaveFileDialog gives irritating error message when using ransomware protection in Windows 10 or 11" (#7228)

Issues.Body:
This is the pull request automatically created by the OneLocBuild task in the build process to check-in localized files generated based upon translation source files (.lcl files) handed-back from the downstream localization pipeline. If there are issues in translations, visit https://aka.ms/ceLocBug and log bugs for fixes. The OneLocBuild wiki is https://aka.ms/onelocbuild and the localization process in general is documented at https://aka.ms/AllAboutLoc.

Issues.Title: [LOC] Comments and region description are not translated in Form.designer.cs
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net 7.0 SDK build: 7.0.100-preview.5.22273.1

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, still repro in previous .Net Core and .Net 5+

### Issue description

Comments and region description are not translated for winforms files

.Net 7.0_CHS:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/170426390-fc2251f7-8005-4344-9cbb-c12218080468.png)

.Net framework_CHS:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/170426483-e926b7a2-ef2a-4c24-a38e-38bc7dcc06c5.png)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a Winforms .NET Core application
2. Open Form1.designer.cs, observe the comments and region description
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[LOC] Comments and region description are not translated in Form.designer.cs" (#7224)

Issues.Title: revert Exception on accessing accessible object after control is disposed
Issues.Body:
This change reverts code that pops up exception from `ListView_OnMouseClick_EditLabel_AsExpected` test

```
System.InvalidOperationException
HResult=0x80131509
Message=Cannot get accessiblity object when ListViewItem is not attached to a ListView.
Source=System.Windows.Forms
StackTrace:
at System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.get_AccessibilityObject() in D:\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\ListViewItem.cs:line 230
at System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewAccessibleObject.GetFocus() in D:\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\ListView.ListViewAccessibleObject.cs:line 174
at System.Windows.Forms.ListView.OnGotFocus(EventArgs e) in D:\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\ListView.cs:line 4769
at System.Windows.Forms.Control.InvokeGotFocus(Control toInvoke, EventArgs e) in D:\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\Control.cs:line 8156
at System.Windows.Forms.Control.WmSetFocus(Message& m) in D:\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\Control.cs:line 12849
at System.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc(Message& m) in D:\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\Control.cs:line 13339
at System.Windows.Forms.ListView.WndProc(Message& m) in D:\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\ListView.cs:line 7034
at System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlNativeWindow.OnMessage(Message& m) in D:\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\Control.ControlNativeWindow.cs:line 65
at System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlNativeWindow.WndProc(Message& m) in D:\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\Control.ControlNativeWindow.cs:line 114
at System.Windows.Forms.NativeWindow.Callback(IntPtr hWnd, WM msg, IntPtr wparam, IntPtr lparam) in D:\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\src\System\Windows\Forms\NativeWindow.cs:line 369

 This exception was originally thrown at this call stack:
System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.AccessibilityObject.get() in ListViewItem.cs
System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewAccessibleObject.GetFocus() in ListView.ListViewAccessibleObject.cs
System.Windows.Forms.ListView.OnGotFocus(System.EventArgs) in ListView.cs
System.Windows.Forms.Control.InvokeGotFocus(System.Windows.Forms.Control, System.EventArgs) in Control.cs
System.Windows.Forms.Control.WmSetFocus(ref System.Windows.Forms.Message) in Control.cs
System.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc(ref System.Windows.Forms.Message) in Control.cs
System.Windows.Forms.ListView.WndProc(ref System.Windows.Forms.Message) in ListView.cs
System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlNativeWindow.OnMessage(ref System.Windows.Forms.Message) in Control.ControlNativeWindow.cs
System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlNativeWindow.WndProc(ref System.Windows.Forms.Message) in Control.ControlNativeWindow.cs
System.Windows.Forms.NativeWindow.Callback(System.IntPtr, Interop.User32.WM, System.IntPtr, System.IntPtr) in NativeWindow.cs

```

Issues.Title: Removed build warning in VS

`unchecked` - fixes a build break, `#pragma` suppression is only a warning.
